trans-unit.source: Learn to back up files and folders from Windows to Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Learn to back up files and folders from Windows to Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to backup Windows Server data by creating a vault, installing the backup agent, and backing up your files and folders to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to backup Windows Server data by creating a vault, installing the backup agent, and backing up your files and folders to Azure.

trans-unit.source: First look: back up files and folders from Windows Server or client to Azure
trans-unit.target: First look: back up files and folders from Windows Server or client to Azure

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to back up your Windows Server (or Windows client) files and folders to Azure using Azure Backup.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to back up your Windows Server (or Windows client) files and folders to Azure using Azure Backup.

trans-unit.source: It's a tutorial intended to walk you through the basics.
trans-unit.target: It's a tutorial intended to walk you through the basics.

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started using Azure Backup, you're in the right place.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started using Azure Backup, you're in the right place.

trans-unit.source: If you want to know more about Azure Backup, read this [overview](backup-introduction-to-azure-backup.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to know more about Azure Backup, read this [overview](backup-introduction-to-azure-backup.md).

trans-unit.source: Backing up files and folders to Azure requires these activities:
trans-unit.target: Backing up files and folders to Azure requires these activities:

trans-unit.source: Step 1
trans-unit.target: Step 1

trans-unit.source: Get an Azure subscription (if you don't already have one).
trans-unit.target: Get an Azure subscription (if you don't already have one).

trans-unit.source: Step 2
trans-unit.target: Step 2

trans-unit.source: Create a backup vault and download the necessary items.
trans-unit.target: Create a backup vault and download the necessary items.

trans-unit.source: Step 3
trans-unit.target: Step 3

trans-unit.source: Install and register the backup agent.
trans-unit.target: Install and register the backup agent.

trans-unit.source: Step 4
trans-unit.target: Step 4

trans-unit.source: Back up your files and folders.
trans-unit.target: Back up your files and folders.

trans-unit.source: How to back up your Windows machine with Azure Backup
trans-unit.target: How to back up your Windows machine with Azure Backup

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Get an Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Get an Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure subscription, create a [free account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/) that lets you access any Azure service.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure subscription, create a [free account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/) that lets you access any Azure service.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create a backup vault and download the necessary items
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create a backup vault and download the necessary items

trans-unit.source: To back up your files and folders, you need to create a backup vault in the region where you want to store the data.
trans-unit.target: To back up your files and folders, you need to create a backup vault in the region where you want to store the data.

trans-unit.source: You also determine how storage is replicated and download credentials and the backup agent.
trans-unit.target: You also determine how storage is replicated and download credentials and the backup agent.

trans-unit.source: To create a backup vault
trans-unit.target: To create a backup vault

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, sign in to the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/) using your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, sign in to the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/) using your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Click **New > Hybrid Integration > Backup**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New > Hybrid Integration > Backup**.

trans-unit.source: Begin preparing to back up your files and folders
trans-unit.target: Begin preparing to back up your files and folders

trans-unit.source: For **Name**, enter a friendly name to identify the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: For **Name**, enter a friendly name to identify the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: For **Region**, select the region closest to your location for faster file transfers.
trans-unit.target: For **Region**, select the region closest to your location for faster file transfers.

trans-unit.source: Click **CREATE VAULT**.
trans-unit.target: Click **CREATE VAULT**.

trans-unit.source: Create a vault
trans-unit.target: Create a vault

trans-unit.source: When the backup vault is ready, it’s listed in the resources for Recovery Services as **Active**.
trans-unit.target: When the backup vault is ready, it’s listed in the resources for Recovery Services as **Active**.

trans-unit.source: Vault status is active
trans-unit.target: Vault status is active

trans-unit.source: After creating the vault, you select how your storage is replicated.
trans-unit.target: After creating the vault, you select how your storage is replicated.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You must choose how storage is replicated right after creating a vault and before any machines are registered to it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You must choose how storage is replicated right after creating a vault and before any machines are registered to it.

trans-unit.source: Once an item has been registered to the vault, storage replication is locked and can't be modified.
trans-unit.target: Once an item has been registered to the vault, storage replication is locked and can't be modified.

trans-unit.source: To select how storage is replicated
trans-unit.target: To select how storage is replicated

trans-unit.source: Click the vault you created.
trans-unit.target: Click the vault you created.

trans-unit.source: On the Quick Start page, select **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: On the Quick Start page, select **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: Configure vault
trans-unit.target: Configure vault

trans-unit.source: Choose the appropriate storage option.
trans-unit.target: Choose the appropriate storage option.

trans-unit.source: If you're using Azure as your primary backup, choose [geo-redundant storage](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#geo-redundant-storage).
trans-unit.target: If you're using Azure as your primary backup, choose [geo-redundant storage](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#geo-redundant-storage).

trans-unit.source: If you're using Azure as a tertiary backup, choose [locally redundant storage](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#locally-redundant-storage).
trans-unit.target: If you're using Azure as a tertiary backup, choose [locally redundant storage](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#locally-redundant-storage).

trans-unit.source: Choose storage replication option
trans-unit.target: Choose storage replication option

trans-unit.source: If you selected **Locally Redundant**, click **Save** since **Geo Redundant** is the default.
trans-unit.target: If you selected **Locally Redundant**, click **Save** since **Geo Redundant** is the default.

trans-unit.source: You use vault credentials to authenticate your machine with the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: You use vault credentials to authenticate your machine with the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Here's how you download those credentials.
trans-unit.target: Here's how you download those credentials.

trans-unit.source: To download vault credentials
trans-unit.target: To download vault credentials

trans-unit.source: The vault credentials file is used only during the registration process and expires after 48 hours.
trans-unit.target: The vault credentials file is used only during the registration process and expires after 48 hours.

trans-unit.source: To return to the **Quick Start** page for your vault, click
trans-unit.target: To return to the **Quick Start** page for your vault, click

trans-unit.source: ![Select your new vault](./media/backup-try-azure-backup-in-10-mins/quick-start-icon.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Select your new vault](./media/backup-try-azure-backup-in-10-mins/quick-start-icon.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Download vault credentials > Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download vault credentials > Save**.

trans-unit.source: Next, you download the backup agent.
trans-unit.target: Next, you download the backup agent.

trans-unit.source: To download the backup agent
trans-unit.target: To download the backup agent

trans-unit.source: Click **Agent for Windows Server or System Center Data Protection Manager or Windows Client > Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Agent for Windows Server or System Center Data Protection Manager or Windows Client > Save**.

trans-unit.source: Save the backup agent
trans-unit.target: Save the backup agent

trans-unit.source: Now that your vault is created and you've downloaded everything, you install and register the backup agent.
trans-unit.target: Now that your vault is created and you've downloaded everything, you install and register the backup agent.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Install and register the backup agent
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Install and register the backup agent

trans-unit.source: Double click the **MARSagentinstaller.exe** from the saved location.
trans-unit.target: Double click the **MARSagentinstaller.exe** from the saved location.

trans-unit.source: Complete the Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent Setup Wizard.
trans-unit.target: Complete the Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent Setup Wizard.

trans-unit.source: To complete the wizard, you'll need to:
trans-unit.target: To complete the wizard, you'll need to:

trans-unit.source: Choose a location for the installation and cache folder.
trans-unit.target: Choose a location for the installation and cache folder.

trans-unit.source: Provide your proxy server info if you use a proxy server to connect to the internet.
trans-unit.target: Provide your proxy server info if you use a proxy server to connect to the internet.

trans-unit.source: Provide your user name and password details if you use an authenticated proxy.
trans-unit.target: Provide your user name and password details if you use an authenticated proxy.

trans-unit.source: Save the encryption passphrase in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Save the encryption passphrase in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you lose or forget the passphrase, Microsoft cannot help recover the backup data.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you lose or forget the passphrase, Microsoft cannot help recover the backup data.

trans-unit.source: Please save the file in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Please save the file in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: It is required to restore a backup.
trans-unit.target: It is required to restore a backup.

trans-unit.source: The agent is now installed and your machine is registered to the vault.
trans-unit.target: The agent is now installed and your machine is registered to the vault.

trans-unit.source: You're ready to configure and schedule your backup.
trans-unit.target: You're ready to configure and schedule your backup.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Back up your files and folders
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Back up your files and folders

trans-unit.source: If the backup agent isn't already open, you can find it by searching your machine for Microsoft Azure Backup.
trans-unit.target: If the backup agent isn't already open, you can find it by searching your machine for Microsoft Azure Backup.

trans-unit.source: In the **Backup agent** click **Schedule Backup**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Backup agent** click **Schedule Backup**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Complete the Schedule Backup Wizard.
trans-unit.target: Complete the Schedule Backup Wizard.

trans-unit.source: While completing the wizard, you will:
trans-unit.target: While completing the wizard, you will:

trans-unit.source: Select which files and folders you want to back up.
trans-unit.target: Select which files and folders you want to back up.

trans-unit.source: Specify your backup schedule (daily or weekly).
trans-unit.target: Specify your backup schedule (daily or weekly).

trans-unit.source: Determine your retention policy.
trans-unit.target: Determine your retention policy.

trans-unit.source: Choose how you want to complete the initial backup (over the network, or offline).
trans-unit.target: Choose how you want to complete the initial backup (over the network, or offline).

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [completing the initial backup offline](backup-azure-backup-import-export.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [completing the initial backup offline](backup-azure-backup-import-export.md).

trans-unit.source: When the wizard is complete return to the **Backup agent** and click **Back Up Now** to complete the initial backup over the network.
trans-unit.target: When the wizard is complete return to the **Backup agent** and click **Back Up Now** to complete the initial backup over the network.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server backup now
trans-unit.target: Windows Server backup now

trans-unit.source: On the **Confirmation** screen, click **Back Up**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Confirmation** screen, click **Back Up**.

trans-unit.source: If you close the wizard before the backup process completes it continues to run in the background.
trans-unit.target: If you close the wizard before the backup process completes it continues to run in the background.

trans-unit.source: When the initial backup is done, the **Jobs** view in the console shows that the job is completed.
trans-unit.target: When the initial backup is done, the **Jobs** view in the console shows that the job is completed.

trans-unit.source: Initial backup complete
trans-unit.target: Initial backup complete

trans-unit.source: Congratulations, you've successfully backed up your files and folders to Azure Backup.
trans-unit.target: Congratulations, you've successfully backed up your files and folders to Azure Backup.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Get more details about [backing up Windows machines](backup-configure-vault.md).
trans-unit.target: Get more details about [backing up Windows machines](backup-configure-vault.md).

trans-unit.source: Now that you've backed up your files and folders, you can [manage your vaults and servers](backup-azure-manage-windows-server.md).
trans-unit.target: Now that you've backed up your files and folders, you can [manage your vaults and servers](backup-azure-manage-windows-server.md).

trans-unit.source: If you need to restore a backup, use this article to [restore files to a Windows machine](backup-azure-restore-windows-server.md).
trans-unit.target: If you need to restore a backup, use this article to [restore files to a Windows machine](backup-azure-restore-windows-server.md).
